alert.note: Alert for Bucks; Lehigh; Montgomery; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 16 at 4:35AM EDT until July 16 at 8:15AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 AM EDT THIS MORNING FOR NORTHWESTERN HUNTERDON, SOUTHWESTERN WARREN, SOUTHEASTERN LEHIGH, SOUTHEASTERN NORTHAMPTON, NORTHWESTERN BUCKS, AND NORTHWESTERN MONTGOMERY COUNTIES... At 435 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 1.5 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Easton, Bethlehem, Pottstown, Quakertown, Hellertown, East Greenville, Alpha, Bloomsbury, Riegelsville, Green Lane, Glendon, and Pleasant Valley. This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 62 and 74. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 9. Northeast Extension between mile markers 38 and 50. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-1.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
